headline: Former MP involved in grisly road accident, driver dies
author: Musembi Nzengu
description: Mutambu was returning to Nairobi from the scene where the St. Joseph's Seminary Mwingi bus plunged into the Enziu river.
articleBody:
Former Mwingi Central MP Joe Mutambu escaped death while his official driver perished when their vehicle collided with a tractor at Kavenge along Thika-Mwingi highway on Sunday night.

Mutambu was returning to Nairobi from the scene where the St. Joseph's Seminary Mwingi bus plunged into the Enziu river.

Mutambu, who lost a number of relatives in the bus accident was on his way to Nairobi after the bus wreckage was retrieved from the river and the last of the dead bodies were recovered when his vehicle was involved in the accident and rolled several times.

His driver died on the spot.

Except for the driver who died, Mutambu and other occupants of the vehicle were rushed to Matuu level four hospital for treatment.

The body of his driver was taken to Mwingi level four hospital morgue.

The former MP had in the day joined fellow leaders from Kitui including Wiper Party leader Kalonzo Musyoka and Kitui Governor Charity Ngilu who had camped at the scene of the school bus accident until the submerged bus was pulled out last evening.

headline: Babu Owino free from attempted murder charge after DJ Evolve withdraws case
author: Rotter Mbuthia
description: Embakasi East MP Babu Owino is smiling from ear to ear, as he has been set free in the attempted murder case against Felix Orinda alias DJ Evolve.
articleBody:
Embakasi East MP Babu Owino is smiling from ear to ear, as he has been set free in the attempted murder case against Felix Orinda alias DJ Evolve.

The ruling happened today after the court allowed the withdrawal of the case by DJ Evolve. This doesn't mean that the politician will not be prosecuted in the second count of behaving disorderly while carrying a firearm.

The judge presiding over the case, Magistrate Bernard Ochoi, set Babu free after the MP had an out-of-court settlement with DJ evolve.

DJ Evolve's family lawyer told the court that they are in the last stages of the negotiations.

Senior principal magistrate Bernard Ochoi heard that the only thing holding them back was documents that they had to present to the prosecution.

The prosecution confirmed talks had been ongoing between the parties. The court heard that the prosecution held two meetings between Babu and Evolve together with the lawyers.

This is after the court allowed the withdrawal of the case by DJ Evolve. The MP was charged with attempting to kill Evolve whom he shot in a club in Kilimani, Nairobi, in 2020.

DJ Evolve was admitted and placed in the ICU at Nairobi Hospital on January 17, after his shooting at Nairobi's B-Club.

headline: Awinja: I almost lost the chance to act on Papa Shirandula
author: PENINAH WAMBUI
description: "I told him I could not do it so I gave him the contacts of a lady named Mwajuma. He never called her, he called me after a month and told me he wanted me to take up the role." -Awinja
articleBody:
Papa Shirandula actress says she landed the role by sheer luck after she went for an audition for a different show and got spotted by Charles Bukeko.

Sharing her story during her story on Churchill show, she says,

"I never auditioned. I had gone for auditions for a different show but Papa Shirandula was in the panel.

We were told we would be called. I waited for almost a year but nothing came through. After a year Papa Shirandula called me and introduced himself to me.

I told him I could not do it so I gave him the contacts of a lady named Mwajuma. He never called her, he called me after a month and told me he wanted me to take up the role."

Awinja says she has acted many roles but this was her hardest.

"It's among the most challenging roles I have ever done. I am a Luhya but it was hard,the accent came along the way.

"I never auditioned. I had gone for auditions for a different show but Papa Shirandula was in the panel.

We were told we would be called. I waited for almost a year but nothing came through. After a year Papa Shirandula called me and introduced himself to me.

I told him I could not do it so I gave him the contacts of a lady named Mwajuma. He never called her, he called me after a month and told me he wanted me to take up the role."

Awinja says she has acted many roles but this was her hardest.

"It's among the most challenging roles I have ever done. I am a Luhya but it was hard,the accent came along the way.

headline: Esther Passaris stuns in Borana outfit (photos)

description: Over the years, Esther Passaris has often made it on best-dressed lists for her stunning, elegant and classy style.The Nairobi Women's
articleBody:

headline: 'I feel at home in politics,' viral Queen of the North speaks
author: PENINAH WAMBUI
description: "I was shocked by the tarmacked roads, the street lights and the building." -Queen of the North
articleBody:
During Raila Odinga's National Azimio la Umoja event, one lady caught the attention of many, especially the 'Team Mafisi' on Twitter.

Aspiring women rep Hezena Lemaletian, famously known as Queen of the North has revealed she first stepped in Kanairo (Nairobi) in 2011.

The Samburu beauty says at the time she was joining campus.

Speaking during an interview on Bonga na Jalas, Lemaletian shared,

"I was shocked by the tarmacked roads, the street lights and the building. I was reporting to the University of Nairobi for a bachelor of Commerce in Finance.

My passion however turned to be serving the community, I started doing a lot of charity work and criticizing my government and that is when I joined politics."

The beauty who aspires to be a Woman Rep of Samburu County says politics is flowing in her blood.

headline: Cop died of poisoning not stress-former minister insists
author: MAURICE ALAL
description: Former Education assistant minister Ayiecho Olweny has alleged foul play in the death of a police inspector who died under mysterious circumstances.
articleBody:
Former Education assistant minister Ayiecho Olweny has alleged foul play in the death of a police inspector who died under mysterious circumstances.

Olweny said Victor Otieno could have been poisoned by a toxic substance in Isiolo where he was based.

He died in Nairobi. Olweny said the doctors at the Nairobi West Hospital where Otieno was taken before lapsing into a coma found toxic substances in his blood.

The former Muhoroni MP dismissed claims Otieno died from stress related to family issues. “We want a thorough probe into the death of the late inspector of police,” Olweny said.

The Kisumu county ODM party chairman is eying the Kisumu Senate seat and will face nominated Senator Rose Nyamunga, senior counsel Tom Ojienda and youthful aspirant Philip Pande in the next year’s general election.

Olweny said that the toxic substances led to swelling of Otieno’s brain before he died while still in a coma. He spoke during the Otieno's burial on Friday in Muhoroni.

He claimed that the police ceremonial outfit belonging to Otieno was missing and asked under what circumstances some of his personal belongings found their way to his home.

“It was heard that Otieno collapsed while on duty in Isiolo before being moved to Nairobi,” Olweny said.

A representative from the National Police Service had claimed that Otieno died as a result of depression related to home issues, which Olweny discounted.

He was described as a hard-working officer who was also very humble. Olweny praised the government for covering the Sh6.4 million hospital bill.

headline: All about the security plans at Sol Fest
author: ELIZABETH NGIGI
description: "The security and safety of all the concert goers is our top priority and we are going to carefully monitor adherence to COVID prevention measures as per the Ministry of Health’s requirements,” says Moriasi Omambia, Manager, Sauti Sol.
articleBody:
Concert organizers for the upcoming Sol Fest are focusing on safety and COVID protocol adherence as the concert date inches closer.

"We have been working around the clock with security agencies, including private security firms to plan and rehearse security and response plans," says Myke, Rabar, CEO, Homeboyz Entertainment PLC.

"The security and safety of all the concert goers is our top priority and we are going to carefully monitor adherence to COVID prevention measures as per the Ministry of Health’s requirements,” says Moriasi Omambia, Manager, Sauti Sol.

The organizers, taking note of the risks involved with popular entertainment events, have implemented tight security measures.

“We are working with a cocktail of security agencies, together with our local enforcement, to cover all the revelers at the Sol Fest event. Security protocols commence from outside the concert walls, leading to various screening checks as you enter the venue. It is important to us that everybody feels safe and has a great time,” assured Mr. Rabar.

Sauti Sol shall headline the concert alongside Bensoul and Nviiri The Story Teller. The all-Kenyan artistes’lineup will also feature several upcoming and established artistes, like Femi One, The Only Rosa, Maandy, Wakadinali Chris Kaiga, DJ Xclusive, CnG THE DJ and DJ DREAM.

The event takes place on 12th December, 2021 at Carnivore Grounds.

headline: Al Shabaab attempts to kidnap 40 Kenyans in Wajir
author: CYRUS OMBATI
description: Police foiled an attempt by al Shabaab militants to abduct an imam from a mosque in Konton, Wajir County.Police and witnesses
articleBody:
Police foiled an attempt by al Shabaab militants to abduct an imam from a mosque in Konton, Wajir County.

Police and witnesses said a gang of about five had raided a local mosque and took hostage about 40 faithful who were present.

The gang ordered them out and tried to drive them into a thicket heading to nearby Kenya-Somalia border.

Their target was the Imam who doubles as a National Police Reservist who was leading the prayers then.

It was in the process that gunshots were fired forcing the gang to abandon their mission and escape.

County police boss Hilary Toroitich confirmed the incident saying that no injuries were reported.

“We have sent a reinforcement to help in tracking the gang,” he said.

The area has been a center of interest as gangs have in the past abducted government officials and killed them without making demands.

A chief was in 2019 killed in the area after an abduction.

The region is among those affected by insecurity related to terrorism.

Al Shabaab terrorists are behind the series of incidents that have grounded operations.

Three al Shabaab terrorists were on Saturday killed by a bomb they were setting up that went off accidentally at a village in Damasa, Mandera County.

Police said the incident happened in Nus Dariq village outside Damasa in Kenya.

The terrorists’ bodies were discovered long after the incident had happened.

There are concerns the persistent attacks are grounding operations in the region.

Transport has been grounded as there is little movements due to fear of attacks.

Officials at the Mandera County Government for instance in June 2021 stopped the movement of their vehicles over increasing terror-related incidents in the area.

headline: Netizens react to DCI report on Donholm man caught pants down
author: Mpasho News
description: A shocked Kangechu who lives in Joska recounted how he met the woman at Barizi Bar in Donholm at around 9 pm, where they enjoyed several rounds of drinks celebrating their newfound friendship.
articleBody:
A 29-year-old man is nursing life-threatening injuries at a city hospital after he was found in a compromising situation with another man’s wife.

The man only identified as Kangechu and the woman were having a good time, when the man of the house busted them in his bedroom at around 4 am. Before Kangechu knew what was happening, he was stabbed several times by the man whom he later learnt was the woman’s husband.

A shocked Kangechu who lives in Joska recounted how he met the woman at Barizi Bar in Donholm at around 9 pm, where they enjoyed several rounds of drinks celebrating their newfound friendship. As one thing led to the other, they agreed to crown the night in the woman’s house.

But as they relished the moment at around 4 am, the man of the house suddenly returned from a trip he had taken to Murang’a, only to be confronted by a strange pair of shoes at the entrance to his house.

On his way to his bedroom, he collected a strange wallet and a pair of trousers, further confirming his fears that there was an unwelcome visitor in his territory.

What followed was a confrontation that turned ugly, leaving Kangechu in serious condition after being stabbed severely. The woman also suffered slight injuries on her fingers, as she tried to prevail upon her knife-wielding husband to give dialogue a chance.

Police officers from the Savannah Police post responded to distress calls from neighbours and saved Kangechu who was bleeding profusely, from the wrath of the angry man. They rushed him to a city hospital where he is admitted in serious condition.

headline: Former 'Wife Material' contestant admits she wears butt-lifters
author: QUEEN SEREM
description: Tanzanian singer Gigy Money who was featured in the controversial show, "Wife Material", by Eric Omondi has admitted to wearing butt lifters.
articleBody:
Tanzanian singer Gigy Money who was featured in the controversial show, "Wife Material", by Eric Omondi has admitted to wearing butt lifters.

"I wear butt lifters and there's a time she (Wema Sepetu) asked me to bring one for her. It is normal for skinny people to do that." She said at a press conference

Gigy went on to throw shade at celebrities that have done plastic surgery to lift their butt.

"They have lost their self-confidence. It is too hot in this country, how do you even apply oil on yourself? You can't feel yourself."

Gigy Money got Eric Omondi in trouble when she fought with a Ugandan contestant while here in Kenya to shoot the reality show.

headline: 'I watched my family go down the river slowly,' Enziu tragedy survivor recalls
author: FRIDAH NALIAKA
description: "I only went back to get this mask from my car and it saved my life. I ran towards the bus and I saw it drifting slowly...and I thought it was just shaking." - Juliet
articleBody:
A requiem mass for 32 people who died after a bus plunged into River Enziu on last is ongoing.

The mass has brought together families of the deceased, who were heading to a wedding when they met their death.

At the mass, Juliet Mutua, the daughter of the couple that was doing a wedding recalled watching her family members disappear into the flooded river.

"I lost two of my sisters their children and my grandchildren watching. Everybody from my family was there, I am the only survivor," she recalled.

Juliet recalled kneeling by the river, as a man held her so as she doesn't jump in.

"It was the hardest experience that I would never wish even my enemy to go through. I watched my family go down the river slowly," she continued.

Juliet was among the occupants of the bus but went back to pick her face mask.

headline: "Nimeua Carol, sijui nifanyaje." Killer cop, Benson Imbatu, told his mother
author: Rotter Mbuthia
description: The name Boniface Imbatu will go down in infamy after the 53-year-old police officer killed 6 people earlier this week, before turning the gun on himself.
articleBody:
The name Boniface Imbatu will go down in infamy after the 53-year-old police officer killed 6 people earlier this week, before turning the gun on himself.

Directorate of Criminal Investigations (DCI) officers from Dagoretti headquarters have now summoned the late Imbatu's mother and cousin to record statements following his confession that he killed his wife, Carol Amakove.

This is according to the late officer's call records obtained by the DCI which show that Imbatu had called his mum and cousin at about 1:03am on Tuesday, December 7, where he would then confess what he had done.

According to a report in The Standard, Imbatu admitted to his mother that he had killed his wife Carol.

"Nimeua Carol. Sijui nifanyaje. (I have murdered Carol, I don't know what to do)"

The late cop's mother said that her son was breathing heavily during the call, before he suddenly switched off the mobile device.

But he would suddenly call his cousin less than two minutes later confessing that he had killed his wife and was in trouble. In this instance, it was the cousin who hung up.

Additional details emerging from the police are that the late officer became jealous after he found Carol speaking to a man at a bar that he had opened for her.

From then on, he became unruly with the angry Imbatu shootinng at a TV before kicking and punching Carol as the unidentified man escaped.

headline: Details of what happened to the fresh GSU recruits in viral photos?
author: CYRUS OMBATI
description: They were all summoned for questioning at the GSU offices before being given the new instructions on Thursday.
articleBody:
A 'feel good' video shot by a group of General Service Unit (GSU) officers has landed them in hot soup.

This is after the entire squadron, comprising 23 officers including the ones who were captured in the clip, was banished to the notorious Magadi Field Training camp for another “re-training” as punishment for their indiscretions.

Other officials said the team is likely to be deployed to the general duties after their new “graduation” likely to happen in weeks.

Officials within the dreaded paramilitary unit said the entire squadron had been banished to the “field” for further training before being posted after the video clip went viral, drawing condemnation from Kenyans on Twitter.

They were all summoned for questioning at the GSU offices before being given the new instructions on Thursday.

The Magadi Field Training Camp is described as “hell on earth” and considered the ultimate test for endurance within the disciplined forces.

Many officers fear it.

There was no official comment from the GSU commandant Douglas Kanja over the developments.

All GSU trainees go through Magadi camp to test their endurance.

The group had completed their nine-month training and was expressing their “joy” through the video they shot and shared only to land in trouble.

Most GSU officers are deployed to specialized units before they are sent to either general duties or the Directorate of Criminal Investigations.

The video is said to have been recorded shortly after President Uhuru Kenyatta presided over the 48th passing-out parade at their Embakasi training college on December 10.

“Attention of the NPS is drawn to a video clip circulating on social media depicting newly graduated GSU officers recording themselves as they make some irresponsible and reckless remarks,” the police headquarters said.

The officers appear to be threatening members of the public.

They, however, say they are proud to be in the service.

“We are representing the red berets...We are coming out there,” they said.

Some members of the public saw it as a threat and it was wrong for the officers to make such remarks, especially at a time when the service was accused of extra-judicial killings, enforced disappearances and brutality.

The Police headquarters assured the public the behaviour portrayed in the clip was not acceptable and does not reflect the values of the GSU and the entire service.

A statement said all graduands went through a rigorous value-based training modeled on democratic policing principles and designed to make them responsive and responsible officers of the law at the service of citizens.

“The oath of allegiance they took as part of their graduation is a testament to the sanctity of their duty to service. The remarks as made in the clip are therefore regrettable and stand condemned,” NPS said.

“An internal review is ongoing with a view of preferring appropriate measures regarding the incident. GSU is renowned for its focused training aimed at producing highly disciplined and responsible officers.”

headline: Most wanted woman escapes arrest at Weston hotel
author: CYRUS OMBATI
description: It is claimed they used a connecting door from their room on the third floor to escape to the next room making it difficult for the officers to pursue them further. Police cordoned off the hotel as a search on the two is intensified in vain.
articleBody:
Wanted businesswoman Mary Wambui Mungai, who is at the centre of a Sh2.2 billion tax evasion case Wednesday night escaped a police dragnet at Weston Hotel, Nairobi where she has been residing.

There was drama at the hotel when police raided there in search of the woman and her co-accused only to realize she had left minutes earlier leaving their personal belongings.

A host of dignitaries from Garissa were at the same facility for a fundraiser. Deputy President William Ruto was among those present.

It is not clear if the DP was informed about the drama as police searched for the two on strength of a warrant they had.

Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) said in a statement Wambui, alongside Purity Njoki Mungai, who are both directors of Purma Holdings Limited, escaped from their hotel rooms a few minutes before the police and KRA officers arrived to arrest them.

“Upon searching the hotel premises, KRA officers and the police found personal belongings of the two including cash, bank cards and car keys, a clear indication that the two were residing at the hotel,” KRA said in the statement.

headline: Revealed-Last call killer cop Benson Imbatu made before his death
author: Rotter Mbuthia
description: This week, Kenyans woke up to the terrible news that police officer, Benson Imbatu had killed 6 before turning the gun on himself.
articleBody:
This week, Kenyans woke up to the terrible news that police officer, Benson Imbatu had killed 6 before turning the gun on himself.

Police are still trying to piece together what happened before the fateful incident. In a report in the Standard newspaper, sleuths revealed that Imbatu had last spoken to his cousin at 1:03 am, in a phone call that lasted close to 90 seconds.

In the call, Imbatu allegedly said that he had killed a woman he only identified as Carol, however, he didn't explain the reason he killed her.

On Monday, the veteran police officer killed his wife, Carol, neighbours and bodaboda riders who had rushed to his house to check what had happened after hearing gunshots.

The cop who was attached to Kabete police station went home with his AK47 rifle and picked a quarrel with his wife, Carol Imbatu, ending with the fateful shooting.

Neighbours and bodaboda riders who operate near the Heights Apartment where the officer stayed rushed to the house to check what had happened.

In the process, the 53-year-old stepped out with his gun blazing and felled five other people including two bodaboda riders and his neighbours in different locations near the house.

headline: School Fires: Maranda High School staff record statement after inferno
author: KNA by Brian Ondeng
description: The interrogation of the teaching and non-teaching staff comes after three students were arrested and questioned over the Sunday morning fire incident.
articleBody:
Investigation into the fire incident that razed a dormitory at Maranda High School on Sunday has been heightened.

Bondo Sub-county Police Commandant, Roselyn Chebosho, has confirmed that top leadership at the school, including the two deputies have recorded statement at the Police Station in connection to the inferno that destroyed property of unknown value.

Chebosho further revealed that Heads of various Departments and none teaching staff have also been asked to record statement, to unearth the cause of perennial fire out breaks at the school.

The interrogation of the teaching and non-teaching staff comes after three students were arrested and questioned over the Sunday morning fire incident after a video clip of the students confessing their actions emerged on social media.

She said that the Directorate of Criminal Investigation (DCI) is convinced that the students cannot set dormitories ablaze with absolute knowledge of the staff fraternity.

In November a fire outbreak at the school gutted down 400-bed capacity dorm at the institution and students were sent home for two weeks.

An investigation by DCI failed to bear any fruits after six students arrested were set free by a Bondo Court, after the police found no evidence to link them to the incident.

"This time around we are not going to leave any stone unturned. We will have to question anybody concerned to get to the bottom of the matter at Maranda," Chebosho revealed.

Last week, form four students at the school were sent home indefinitely for threatening to burn the school.

On Sunday Siaya County Director of Education, Nelson Sifuna, closed down the school indefinitely.

Attempts to reach school Principal, Edwin Namachanja, to shed more light on those under investigation failed to materialize as he failed to pick his phone on several occasions.

headline: In whose hands are we safe? Video of GSU officers issuing threats sparks uproar
author: FRIDAH NALIAKA
description: The officers who were speaking in Sheng notifying civilians that they are ready to handle them.
articleBody:
A video of youthful GSU recruits celebrating their graduation has been a topic of discussion on social media platforms in Kenya.

In the video, the officers who were speaking in sheng notifying civilians that they are ready to handle them.

"Raia! Tushamaliza! Tunawakilisha! Hii ni nini? Red Beret! Tunakuja nje...Hii ni squad 26, ya wabaya!" they said.

Their actions sparked uproar from the public who felt threatened, with the National Police Service describing it as “irresponsible and reckless.”

“Attention of the National Police Service is drawn to a video clip circulating on social media depicting newly graduated General Service Unit (GSCU) officers recording themselves as they make some irresponsible and reckless remarks,” read part of the statement from NPS.

Adding,

“We wish to clarify and assure the public that the behavior portrayed in the clip is not acceptable and does not reflect the values of the GSU, Kenya Police Service and the National Police Service."
